```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
lit_rev_data <- read.table(file = "studies.csv", header = T, sep = ";", dec = ".", fill = T, quote="\"")

# join lit rev data together with analyzed word frequencies
full_data <- full_join(word_freq_per_pdf, lit_rev_data, by = c("study" = "id"))

# visualize most common words as bargraph
word_freq_sum %>%
  filter(sum > 1000) %>%
  mutate(word = reorder(word, sum)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(word, sum)) +
  geom_col() +
  xlab(NULL) +
  coord_flip()

# generally works: visualize most common words per pdf
word_freq_per_pdf[1:150000,] %>%
  filter(count > 50) %>% 
  mutate(word = reorder(word, count)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(word, count)) +
  geom_col() +
  xlab(NULL) +
  coord_flip() +
  facet_wrap(~study, ncol = 4, scales = "free")
```
